page.title: 05BULLO PILL HARBOUR
page.content: LAST CENTURY BULLO PILL WAS A HARBOUR WHICH WAS BUSY ENOUGH TO TAKE MOST OF THE TRADE FROM LYDNEY HARBOUR,BECAUSE IT WAS NEARER BY ROAD TO GLOUCESTER. THE HARBOUR BEGAN TO SILT UP AND A CANAL WAS BUILT ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE SEVERN WHICH TOOK GOODS ALL THE WAY TO THE HEART OF GLOUCESTER. BY 1900 BULLO PILL HARBOUR WAS ABANDONED AND NOW THE QUAY WALLS HAVE HUGE GAPS;THE GATES ARE ROTTED AND HANGING OFF THEIR POSTS. THE OWNER TOLD US THE GATES ALONE WOULD COST Â£60,000 TO REPLACE. HE HOPES IT WILL BE POSSIBLE TO DEVOLOP THE SITE AS A YACHT MARINA AND AS A TOURIST ATTRACTION.
